## Summary
:::note
This rule is currently only available in the [2.0 beta release](/blog/biome-v2-0-beta).
:::
- Diagnostic Category: [`lint/nursery/useAnchorHref`](/reference/diagnostics#diagnostic-category)
- This rule doesn't have a fix.
- The default severity of this rule is [**error**](/reference/diagnostics#error).
- This rule belongs to the following domains:
  - [`qwik`](/linter/domains#qwik)
- Sources: 
  - Same as [`qwik/jsx-a`](https://github.com/BuilderIO/eslint-plugin-qwik/blob/main/docs/rules/jsx-a.md)

:::caution
This rule is part of the [nursery](/linter/rules/#nursery) group.
:::
## Description
Enforces `href` attribute for `<a>` elements.

Ensures `<a>` tags are either valid links (with href) or replaced with buttons for actions.
See [WCAG 4.1.2](https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG22/Understanding/name-role-value) for accessibility requirements.

## Examples

### Invalid

```jsx
<a>Link</a>
```

<pre class="language-text"><code class="language-text">code-block.jsx:1:1 <a href="https://biomejs.dev/linter/rules/use-anchor-href">lint/nursery/useAnchorHref</a> ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━<br /><br />  <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">✖</span></strong> <span style="color: Tomato;">Missing required </span><span style="color: Tomato;"><strong>href</strong></span><span style="color: Tomato;"> attribute on </span><span style="color: Tomato;"><strong>a</strong></span><span style="color: Tomato;"> element</span><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">&gt;</span></strong> <strong>1 │ </strong>&lt;a&gt;Link&lt;/a&gt;<br />   <strong>   │ </strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><br />    <strong>2 │ </strong><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">Anchor tags without href attributes are inaccessible to keyboard navigation and screen readers, violating WCAG 2.2 Success Criterion 4.1.2 (Name, Role, Value).</span><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">Use </span><span style="color: lightgreen;"><strong>href</strong></span><span style="color: lightgreen;"> for navigation or </span><span style="color: lightgreen;"><strong>&lt;button&gt;</strong></span><span style="color: lightgreen;"> for actions. Reference: </span><span style="color: lightgreen;"><a href="https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG22/Understanding/name-role-value">WCAG 4.1.2</a></span><br />  <br /></code></pre>

```jsx
<a target="_blank">External</a>
```

<pre class="language-text"><code class="language-text">code-block.jsx:1:1 <a href="https://biomejs.dev/linter/rules/use-anchor-href">lint/nursery/useAnchorHref</a> ### Valid

```jsx
<a href="/home">Home</a>
```

```jsx
<a href="https://example.com" target="_blank">External</a>
```

## How to configure
```json title="biome.json"
{
	"linter": {
		"rules": {
			"nursery": {
				"useAnchorHref": "error"
			}
		}
	}
}

```
